data.text:
Francis Albert Sinatra1

M, #249632, b. 12 December 1915, d. 14 May 1998

Last Edited=20 Nov 2007

Frank Sinatra, 1960 1

Francis Albert Sinatra was born on 12 December 1915 at Hoboken, New Jersey, U.S.A. .1 He was the son of Anthony Martin Sinatra and Natalie Dolly Garaventa.1 He married, firstly, Nancy Barbato on 4 February 1939 at Jersey City, New Jersey, U.S.A. .1 He and Nancy Barbato were divorced on 29 October 1951.1 He married, secondly, Ava Gardner, daughter of Jonas Bailey Gardner and Mary Elizabeth Baker, on 7 November 1951.1 He and Ava Gardner were divorced in 1957.1 He married, thirdly, Mia Farrow, daughter of John Farrow and Maureen O'Sullivan, on 19 July 1966.1 He and Mia Farrow were divorced in 1968.1 He married, fourthly, Barbara Blakeley in July 1976.1 He died on 14 May 1998 at age 82 at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, Los Angeles, California, U.S.A. .1

Francis Albert Sinatra also went by the nick-name of Frank.1 He was awarded the Academy Award in 1954 Best Supporting Actor in From Here to Eternity.1 He was awarded the honorary degree of Doctor of Engineering by Stevens Institute of Technology, Hoboken, New Jersey, U.S.A. , on 23 May 1985.1 He was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom on 23 May 1985.1

Children of Francis Albert Sinatra and Nancy Barbato

Nancy Sinatra+1 b. 8 Jun 1940

Frank Sinatra, Jr.+1 b. 10 Jan 1944

Christina Sinatra1 b. 20 Jun 1948

Betty Karp1

F, #249633

Last Edited=5 Nov 2007

Betty Karp married Leonard Marx, son of Sam Marx and Minnie Schoenberg, in 1917.1

From 1917, her married name became Marx.1

Child of Betty Karp and Leonard Marx

Maxine Marx1 b. 1918
